> Standard snake movement: when moving, head goes to new position, each body segment moves to the position of the previous segment in front, so the segment that was at position 1 moves to where head was, position 2 moves to where position 1 was, and so on, down to tail.
> 
> If no food, the tail position is vacated.
> 
> If food eaten, the tail does not vacate, so the snake grows by one cell; the new head position is added, and all body segments move, so the last segment (tail) stays, and a new segment is effectively added at the tail end.
> 
> In terms of positions: after moving and eating, the body segments include the previous positions plus the head moves, so the tail remains.
>

> After move with eating: head to new, seg1 to old head, seg2 to old seg1, ..., tail stays where it is, and the old tail position is still occupied, so snake length increases.
